topic.title: Probably not a topic people want to discuss in a decentralized arena
topic.body:
First off, I'm someone who is strongly opposed to any governmental censorship. Secondly, I'm actually a believer in self-censorship and encouraging people to recognize and respect the voices of those who can't speak for themselves.

So my question or rather discussion starter revolves around the problems of a non-censorship decentralized (no outside controller) community (like Zeronet).  It is even harder to have this discussion when most of us in the community value our freedom and anonymous nature that comes with participating in Zeronet.  I for one am fine if people know who I am, but i respect the rights and desires of other individuals who wish to remain anonymous and therefore I will go to bat for those that wish to remain anonymous.

But this leads me to my question I was talking with some friends about in a pub last night.  What do we do about violence and abuse (porn and otherwise) that is perpetrated upon children who have no voice to stand up against such stuff.  If we truly desire to be anonymous and decentralized, are we stating that we don't care if this stuff occurs on Zeronet?  I'm not talking about how different countries and cultures view certain crimes/activities.  Any time where there is cross-border disagreements on "the right and wrong" of an action should be allowed to flourish and discussions should take place freely.  But I don't know of any culture, race, country, that says that child pornography/violence is an acceptable practice.  So, I leave this question to people....

How do we or how should we, as users of Zeronet approach this issue of child violence/pornography?  Or is this an impossible issue to solve within a decentralized anonymous community?

topic.body:
The ability for the author to remove other people's comments that are either spam or simple reproductions of a post that the person leaving a comment is simply trying to get people to visit their own site.

It right now is WAY to easy to spam other people's blog posts with ZERO way to kick the posts off a person's site.

topic.title: I don't care
topic.body:
/*Sorry for the rant*/

I don't care whether you believe that...
- blacks are better than whites or 
- whites are better than donkeys or 
- that Hitler was great or gay or 
- that 9/11 was an inside job or
- Mohammed raped little girls and stole parts of the Koran from Jewish wives tales or
- Christians are killing babies or
- Muslims are killing Christians or
- Iraq hid weapons of mass destruction or gassed millions of their own people or
- Aliens are real (which would be really cool by the way) or
- This or that was a hoax or not or
- The rational behind when its okay to assault someone else or
.... whatever

Everyone has an opinion just like everyone has an asshole and in the same manner both normally stink!!!


Zeronet SHOULD be about inclusion.  If you truly want to BUILD something great and contribute to the idea of a decentralized and censorship-free environment you might find people more willing to contribute their time, money, and energy to further developing out the infrastructure and capabilities of Zeronet if you kept your hatred of some group or person out of the "town square".  


If all you can do is act like a 12 year old that is experiencing his first night staying up after curfew and spewing whatever the hell you think people might find funny you will kill whatever hope Zeronet has of gaining traction.  Why do you think ALL social networks, dating sites, and other sites that are trying to encourage new users to join DO NOT show any of the hate speech or idiotic "opinion" on their frontpage... even though if you look you can find it all over "on the inside or side areas".  It's because the VAST majority of people don't care about fringe opinions.  If you find people that appreciate your own personal opinions then build out your own section and ask people to join to further your exciting and intellectual communication.


Asking people to be aware that derogatory (towards ANY direction) is a deterrent to new people getting involved in a community is NOT censorship.  It's asking people to actually grow up and realize you can do whatever you want ON YOUR OWN TIME and with YOUR OWN FRIENDS.  Forcing everyone participate in your own personal derogatory rants is not just rude but just plain destructive to the community as a whole.  (I personally don't think that ZeroTalk should be about linking to the latest and greatest porn either... but I'm pretty sure I'm a minority on that issue.)


When I want people to understand the passion I have for Bach or that I think Beagles are the best dog or that the best way to travel is by sailboat or that I disagree with the current hagiography of Nelson Mandela due to my being in South Africa and seeing first hand what he did... I'll do it on my time and on my own sites because I believe that's where it belongs.


What is ZeroTalk:
- A conversation place about Zeronet
- A "getting started" area
- A place to share about new sites that have been built (not for repeat spamming every hour a new thread about "Come see my awesome site!!!")
- A place people can ask questions and get answers
- A place to enhance Zeronet


But hey, you can disagree with me and I'm fine with that.  But I'll ask you a two part question... If you want to spam your derogatory crap (regardless of what side or about what topic) are you 1) okay with destroying whatever hope Zeronet has of becoming a useful tool and 2) if you decide to post derogatory crap, will you agree to let anyone else post opposing derogatory crap and you will be happy when someone insults you because you believe in "free speech" are are just so delighted when people/things/places that you hate are using this free speech and censorship-free opportunity YOU "cherish" to insult you.


To be a true free speech/censorship-free community you have to agree that everyone has opinions BUT also understand that everyone needs to be an adult and realize there are times and places for opinions.  And if you don't understand this distinction than all you are is a drain on society. 


If you made it to the end... thanks for ready this brain dump.  I do hope that the awesome opportunity that Zeronet provides for users won't be squandered by the "vocal minority" who haven't learned how to properly act in public and social settings.

1_12fNTMaQH1mN5bPehdvkNgTAVxzQXop87e.body:
When people want to visit a zeronet site, that site requests the IP address from the bittorrent network of the visitor.  Your computer now downloads the content.json file which contains all other pieces of the site, hashes, and the site owners cryptographic signature.  Your local zeronet system verifies the downloaded content.json file using the site's address and the site owner's signature on the file.  If those match then the other files are downloaded and verified using SHA512.  At this point your "visited" sites are now served by your own localhost. If and when the site owner (in possession of the private key for that site address... think bitcoin public and private keys) modifies that site, the new content.json file is published to the peers and it goes through the whole process again, verifying the keys and downloading (updating) to your localhost.

This essentially makes the sites you visit accessible EVEN without access to the internet, because once they are on your localhost you are visiting your localhost (until which time the original site creator issues a NEW content.json file).

That's the high level view of what's going on.

1_1Kg7CXZM5h3wTPENsTDwWUmRBf9VhYy2cW.body:
My take on this is probably a little different.  I think people should promote Zeronet for what it IS... and not what it will be or could be.  I would venture so far as to say we shouldn't be promoting this as a replacement for systems that already work.  But we should highlight the BENEFITS that Zeronet currently brings to the table.

1. A Unique and Easy to Use Decentralized (P2P) Communication Platform.
2. Censorship-free arenas in which to share and discuss ideas.
3. The ability to work online AND offline so that you can write and share when you are offline and when you finally have a connection your content will be passed to all the peers listening for changes.

And such... Our focus (while people are building out functionality) should be to extol the virtues of Zeronet and not just try and copy systems.  I personally value the idea that everything is served to me off of my own localhost and therefore don't really want a YouTube since that essentially means I have to download everything to my machine before I play the video and at that point it defeats the purpose.

Stay focused on the benefits of a decentralized communication platform and I think amazing things will grow out of this foundation.

(just my 2 cents)

> [angristan](#comment_48_1MEWJRMLgvofqG9Mbsb2Rc4hFFyv7HeRx7): To sum up : we need a tool to censor things  only for ourselves not for everyone else like in a centralized system.

This is key.  A "hide" function that only hides or doesn't sync with peers on our own localhosts.  Since Zeronet serves our individual viewing experience from our own localhost, having the ability to "hide" or "unsync" specific user contributions from our own localhost simply allows us to control which pieces of content we share and sync with other Zeronet peers.  This does NOTHING to censor anyone, it just allows individuals to set their OWN boundaries and to control their OWN experience on zeronet.
